data.benefits: Scheme provides grant of upto Rs. 3 lakhs to generate novel ideas and boost innovation.
data.eligibility:
Eligibility Criteria for Startups:
Should not exceed 10 years of existence from the date of incorporation.
Must comply with DPIIT norm
Annual turnover must not exceed Rs. 100 crore in any financial year since incorporation.
Must not be formed by splitting or reconstructing an existing business.
Must be registered in Rajasthan or have a branch/sales office in the state.
data.conditions: Based on their QRate and development period various incentive can be availed.
data.beneficiaries:

data.prerequisites: Based on their QRate and development period various incentive can be availed.
data.nodal_agency: Department Of Information Technology and Communication
data.context:
• The policy was officially launched by Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot at the second edition of the Rajasthan DigiFest 2022 in Jodhpur, as part of the Department of Information Technology and Communication’s three-day youth and entrepreneurship summit from November 11-13, 2022. 
  • To establish Rajasthan as India’s leading entrepreneurship and innovation centre by providing a conducive environment to foster a thriving and diverse startup ecosystem delivering sustainable economic and societal outcomes for the State and people of Rajasthan.Rajasthan with its history in entrepreneurship, intellectual and human capital, is on the path to emerge as a center of innovation and business activity. 
  • The State is striving to build a conducive ecosystem for startups to promote innovation, create new products and services, generate employment, and thus strengthen the regional and national economy To further ignite the spirit of entrepreneurship in the State and convert ideas into businesses, the State Government had launched iStart, the flagship startup program which has enabled growth for over 2000 associated startups. It is one of the most recognised state-run startup ecosystems in the country.
data.objective:
Foster rapid job creation and skill enhancement across the State 
Position Rajasthan as the #1 state in innovation in thrust areas such as agriculture, education, healthcare and fintech.
data.description:
1. Ideation Grant will be Provided to startup registered Under iStart Program of Gov if the idea is approved by Gov. 
  2. All Pre-Seed stage startups registered under the iStart program shall be eligible to a grant of Rs. 2.4 lakhs provided the idea meets the criteria set by the Evaluation Committee, as notified by the Government from time to time. 
  3. Also If more than 50% Capital Is funded by Women then the startup are eligible for additional Rs. 0.6 lakhs Grant
data.how_to_apply: Businesses have to register to iStart portal on Gov of Rajasthan.
data.funding_facilitator: Department of information Technology and communication
data.funding_mechanism: The applicant will get incentive after the approval of the application by the concerned authority.
data.highlights:
1. The Marwadi International Federation (MIF), a non-profit organisation, has signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with an incubation hub of the University of Rajasthan to help state's youth enter the startup sector. 
  2. Rajasthan to invest Rs 10,000 crore for 20,000 new MSMEs and 1 lakh jobs: RFC’s Balwant Singh Ligree.
data.additional_info: A startup that is in the idea generation, refinement and validation stage
